Drop Jager, not Bombs

  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
  • warning: fopen() [function.fopen]: Filename cannot be empty in /nfs/c04/h01/mnt/66721/domains/themonthlychallenge.com/tags/release-1.1/includes/file.inc on line 757.
  • The file could not be created.
Wed, 08/06/2008 - 09:54 | by Jesse

Can you believe that after over 2 years of working in bars that I had never had a Jägerbomb? I've had Cherry Bombs and Car Bombs (but don't try ordering one of those at an Irish bar - it's a bit of a sensitive subject.) So, this past Sunday, I decided to go for it. In general, I think it's a really bad idea to mix caffeine and energy drinks with alcohol, but that night was special. I'm a fan of Red Bull and a fan of Jägermeister, but I was (not really) surprised to find out that the two mixed together are not very tasty. They don't go nearly as well together as, say, eggs & grapes.

On Monday, I was privileged enough to have Sam Smith's Nut Brown Ale. As the name implies, it does have a slightly nutty flavor, and to an unassuming palate such as mine, there is some sort of odd spice flavor in there. (Not like a cayenne spice - like a funky nutmeg or something.) Maybe I should learn how to taste wine & beer (& liquor?) Either way this beer was delicious.

Last night, Charles brought over a gift which he was sure I'd never had - Cusqueña cerveza, el oro de las Incas. It smelled like a frat house the day after a big party. Fortunately, it tasted better than it smelled - but that's not saying much. I wouldn't recommend it, unless you like skunky Miller High Life. In that case, it's a step up.

For the rest of the week, I'm headed off to Las Vegas. I'm sure I'll have no problems finding fun new drinks out there. I'm thinking: Incredible Hulk, Oyster Shooters, and something which has been set on fire.

Tags:
  • beer
  • review
